page.title: 12TOURISM LLANWENARTH HOUSE
page.content: On June 24th 1985 some pupils from Govilon School visited Llanwenarth House,which was built in 1550,in the village of Govilon.The main part of the house is made out of stone and slate,with bricks over the doors and window.There are three floors.On the first floor there are 11 rooms.The window frames in the kitchen are made out of stone mullion.On the next floor there are 14 rooms.One of the rooms was a bacon room used for curing meat. In one of the bedrooms is a fireplace dating from 1600.The large garden contains a walled orchard.The famous Welsh family of Morgon built the house some 400 years ago and their family lived there until about 1953.
